entries.meaning: (linguistics, uncountable) The study of the way sounds function in languages, including phonemes, syllable structure, stress, accent, intonation, and which sounds are distinctive units within a language.
(linguistics, countable) The way sounds function within a given language; a phonological system.
examples: The Achean, the ancient Malayu and other mixed phonologies possessing a considerable degree of harshness, were thus formed.
